Ballot Comment: "A cause of death is one in an ordered list of caused in a cause of death pathway". Ballot: US Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting
Ballot Comment:
The Death Pronouncement Performer resource is is used to convey the identity of practitioner that performed the death pronouncement and determined the actual or presumed date and time of death. It includes the name, qualification, and license number of the performer. It should be a practitioner resource, not a Location resource, as no 'location' information is conveyed here. 

Always include codeSystem where code is present. In this resource, as well as the Certifier, Mortician, Funeral Home Director resources, if the id of the actor is an NPI number, include the NPI code system (2.16.840.1.113883.4.6).

Ballot: US Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting
Ballot Comment: This IG should use a standard IG framework, or at least meet the same quality criteria as them. There are no differential and snapshot tabs for instance, and many constraints are not fully shown. For example: on BirthRecordIdentifier, the StructureDefinition diagram does not actually show that subject is a reference to VRDR-Decendent until you hover over it.

Ballot: US Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting
Ballot Comment: It's really unclear what this profile adds beyond what is in US Core Patient, other than requireing a Social Security Number as the one and only identifier, which I don't think is the intent since many persons do not have SSNs and would need to use other identifiers, and requiring the Within-City-Limits-Indicator extension (though it shows as "address1 in the StructureDefinition diagram which makes no sense). Recommend removing any constraints that mearly duplicate US Core Constraints and using a standard framework as mentioned above so the IG is actually readable. .

Ballot: US Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting

Autopsy performed (Situation)/719828003
Autopsy not done (situation)/ and 434661000124109
Autopsy Planned
